channel.title: linux on Programming thoughts
channel.description: Recent content in linux on Programming thoughts

item.title: Introduction to Linux
item.description: A brief history of Unix In 1969 (also the year in which people went to the moon for the first time in human history) the very first version of Unix operating system was created in assembly language for the minicomputer PDP-7 at Bell Labs (9 Nobel Prizes have been awarded for the work completed at this phenomenon laboratory). The PDP-7 on which Ken Thompson developed and ran the first version of Unix had a really small memory (4 kilobytes).
